algorithms.compGeometry

Class ParabolaLeastSquares

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.compGeometry.ParabolaLeastSquares

  • public class ParabolaLeastSquares
extends java.lang.Object
    y = ax^2 + bx + c least squares fit is minimizing the sum of square of residuals summation from i=1 to n points of (y_i - (ax_i^2 + bx_i + c))^2 to minimize, need each partial deriv = 0, that is d(eqn)/da = 0, etc the 3 partial derivatives are summarized as a * sum_i=1toN (x_i)^4 + b * sum_i=1toN (x_i)^3 + c * sum_i=1toN (x_i)^2 = sum_i=1toN (x_i)^2 * y_i a * sum_i=1toN (x_i)^3 + b * sum_i=1toN (x_i)^2 + c * sum_i=1toN (x_i) = sum_i=1toN (x_i) * y_i a * sum_i=1toN (x_i)^2 + b * sum_i=1toN (x_i)^1 + c * n = sum_i=1toN y_i given a set of points, can calc moments x y x^2 x^3 x^4 xy yx^2 (when placed in a matrix, is known as Vandermonde) sum each of those for the points then can solve the 3 equations for a, b, c using linear algebra.
    Author:
    nichole

        public float[] solve()
             solve for the coefficients of a parabola.
     The results can be applied in the following way:
         y = coeff[0]*x*x + x*coeff[1] + coeff[2]
